sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Private Detention Facility Moratorium Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Private Detention Facility Moratorium Act.

sections.heading: Legislative findings. The General Assembly hereby finds and declares that the management and operation of any detention facility involves functions that are inherently governmental
sections.text: Detention requires the exercise of coercive police powers over individuals that should not be delegated to the private

sections.heading: Definition. In this Act, "detention facility" means any building, facility, or structure used to detain individuals, not including State work release centers or juvenile or adult residential treatment facilities
sections.text: Definition. In this Act, "detention facility" means any building, facility, or structure used to detain individuals, not including State work release centers or juvenile or adult residential treatment facilities.

sections.text: Exemptions. This Act does not prohibit the State, a unit of local government, or any sheriff that owns, manages, or operates a detention facility from contracting with a private entity or person to provide ancillary services in that facility, such as medical services, food service, educational services, or facility repair and maintenance.

sections.heading: Applicability.  In case of any conflict between this Act and any other law, this Act shall control.
